title: CRS BG and LRG target selection and angular clustering
description: The Cosmology Redshift Survey (4MOST-CRS) will enable precision cosmological measurements using spectroscopic clustering of galaxies and quasars over 0.1 < z < 2.5 across >7000 deg^2. This talk presented the CRS Bright Galaxy and Luminous Red Galaxy target selections and angular clustering tests used to assess catalogue quality and uniformity.

title: Angular two-point correlation function of Euclid Early Data
description: Presented measurements of the angular two-point correlation function using Euclid Early Data, focusing on methodology, early catalogue validation, and key systematic checks relevant to clustering analyses.

title: Mapping the Universe: The Past, Present, and Future of Sky Surveys
description: A public talk on how sky surveys evolved from early star catalogues to modern projects such as Gaia, 4MOST, DESI, LSST, and Euclid, and how these surveys help answer questions about galaxy growth, dark energy, and the cosmic web.
